meanings.definition: Covered in a sticky or viscous substance
meanings.sent1: The candy became goey after sitting in the sun.
meanings.sent2: The goey syrup dripped down the sides of the ice cream cone.
meanings.sent3: The goey glue made it hard to separate the pages of the book.
meanings.sent4: Her goey hands were evidence of her love for baking.
meanings.sent5: The goey mud clung to his shoes as he walked through the swamp.

meanings.definition: Having a texture that is soft and slightly liquid
meanings.sent1: The goey pudding melted in my mouth.
meanings.sent2: The goey cheese oozed out of the sandwich.
meanings.sent3: The goey clay was perfect for molding into shapes.
meanings.sent4: Her goey hair stuck to her forehead in the humidity.
meanings.sent5: The goey soap slipped out of his grasp in the shower.

meanings.definition: Showing a lack of firmness or solidity
meanings.sent1: The goey jelly wobbled on the plate.
meanings.sent2: The goey dough was difficult to shape into cookies.
meanings.sent3: The goey balloon slowly deflated after being pricked.
meanings.sent4: Her goey excuses didn't convince anyone.
meanings.sent5: The goey sandcastle collapsed under the weight of the wave.
